0: A renewed attempt to make the lyrics of O Canada more gender-neutral won't be supported by a newly elected Conservative MP in southwestern Ontario. NEWLINE_CHAR NEWLINE_CHAR Karen Vecchio, who became the MP for Elgin-Middlesex-London last October, said she will oppose Liberal MP Mauril Bélanger's second attempt to change some of the words in the national anthem. NEWLINE_CHAR NEWLINE_CHAR "I think it just opens up a can of worms that we can look at each and every line of that national anthem," Vecchio said in an interview with CBC News. NEWLINE_CHAR NEWLINE_CHAR Tory MP Karen Vecchio says she will oppose Liberal MP Mauril Belanger's bid to change the lyrics of O Canada. (parl.gc.ca) NEWLINE_CHAR NEWLINE_CHAR "We will be changing the entire national anthem into something that we don't even recognize," said Vecchio. NEWLINE_CHAR NEWLINE_CHAR In the previous Parliament, Bélanger put forth a private member's bill seeking to change the words "in all thy sons command" to "in all of us command." NEWLINE_CHAR NEWLINE_CHAR The bill was defeated at that time, but it was then supported by opposition MPs. The Liberals now have a majority government, which Bélanger is a part of.
